item.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverParty for Socialism and Liberation - PSL was live.Police agencies in the Denver area arrested...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverParty for Socialism and Liberation - PSL was live.

Police agencies in the Denver area arrested anti-war organizers in a coordinated assault today. People were arrested in a Home Depot parking lot, at their homes..., and after they were pulled over while driving. Those arrested were the leaders to demand justice for Elijah McClain, who was brutally murdered by the Aurora Police Department. They are still in jail, with the exception of one person. They are facing multiple felony charges and years in prison in an obvious frame-up aimed at stopping the movement for justice for Elijah McClain. Drop the charges!

Please join an Emergency Livestream tonight, Sept. 17th for updates on this developing situation, and the PSL’s plans to mobilize against this government attack.

See More

item.title: EMERGENCY MOBILIZATION AT THE COLORADO STATE CAPITOL BUILDING...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

EMERGENCY MOBILIZATION AT THE COLORADO STATE CAPITOL BUILDING THIS SATURDAY 9/19 AT 12PM!

BREAKING: On Sept. 17, police agencies in the Denver area arrested anti-racist organizers in a coordinated assault. People were arrested in a Home Depot parking lot, at their homes, and after they were pulled over while driving. Those arrested were the leaders to demand justice for Elijah McClain, who was brutally murdered by the Aurora Police Department. They are still in jail, with the... exception of one person. They are facing multiple felony charges and years in prison in an obvious frame-up aimed at stopping the movement for justice for Elijah McClain.

Add your name to sign the petition and join the campaign to demand that all the charges be dropped!

Petition text:

I demand that all charges be dropped on anti-racist organizers in the Denver area. It is an obvious political frame-up aimed at stopping the movement for justice for Elijah McClain.

item.title: The world is facing unprecedented crises—endless war, climate...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

The world is facing unprecedented crises—endless war, climate change, the COVID-19 pandemic, economic collapse—and neither the Democrats or Republicans can offer any real solutions. Both parties defend the system that created these crises!

But there is a Party that represents the Peoples' interests! TOMORROW, 4PM MDT: Tune into a webinar to learn more about socialism and the PSL’s 2020 socialist campaign! #VoteSocialist2020 #LaRiva2020

Tune in here: https://www.facebook.com/pslweb/
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: Denver Police shot and killed another man last night, the third...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Denver Police shot and killed another man last night, the third person killed by DPD in one week.

One man died following a police shooting late Tuesday along Colorado Boulevard, just south of Interstate 25.

thedenverchannel.com

1 man dead following police shooting on S. Colorado Boulevard

item.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverParty for Socialism and Liberation - PSL🗣️ On this day in 1973, a U.S.-engineered military...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverParty for Socialism and Liberation - PSL

🗣️ On this day in 1973, a U.S.-engineered military coup led by Augusto Pinochet deposed Chile’s democratically-elected socialist president, Salvador Allende, an...d ushered in a fascist regime that killed tens of thousands of Chileans.

On the morning of Sept. 11, 1973, as tanks and personnel carriers circled the presidential palace in Santiago, Pinochet’s forces fired into the palace while planes dropped bombs. Allende and a core of his staff resisted until the fascist troops stormed the building. Allende was killed.

By afternoon, all government offices in the country were taken over. Within weeks, thousands of leftists, intellectuals, unionists and supporters of Allende were rounded up and tortured in the National Stadium. Many were executed. Congress was suspended, unions and political parties banned, and habeas corpus eliminated.

Among these desparecidos was famous Communist poet and singer Victor Jara. Born into poverty to a peasant family, by the age of 6 Jara was already working on a farm. Yet he became a distinguished theater director and played a pivotal role in establishing the Nueva Canción Chilena movement.

Before Jara was murdered, soldiers smashed his fingers and then mocked him, handed him a guitar and forced him to play a song. In a display of immense revolutionary resilience, with broken hands Jara sang the song that was the anthem of the movement, Venceremos – We Will Triumph. Jara’s life was brutally taken by army lieutenant Pedro Pablo Barrientos. Barrientos who played Russian roulette with Jara until a shot finally rang out. He was then shot another 44 times, and his body dumped in the street along with the hundreds of others.

In his final hours, Jara composed one last song on a scrap of paper. The song ends, “How hard it is to sing when I must sing of horror... What I see, I have never seen, what I have felt and what I feel, will give birth to the moment.”

Victor Jara’s legacy will live on forever in his music and perseverance. No amount of guns, tanks, prisons, or unjust laws can stop the movement towards justice.

¡Víctor Jara presente!

See More
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: Justice for Antonio Blackbear, shot to death by Denver Police...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Justice for Antonio Blackbear, shot to death by Denver Police this Wednesday, September 9. Antonio is the seventh person fatally shot by DPD this year, and the cousin of Paul Castaway, who was murdered by Denver Police in 2015.

The racist violence of the police against our community has not let up, even in the midst of a nationwide protest movement putting a spotlight on their brutality. If our communities are ever to be safe, we have to keep fighting and building the movement for justice and against the racist police and the system they serve.
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: “Scientists have a hard time predicting exactly how fast...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

“Scientists have a hard time predicting exactly how fast climate change will unfold and the extent of the effects. We are currently only at 1 C warming and already experiencing extreme weather and devastation around the globe. The much-touted Paris Agreement’s voluntary commitments have us on target for 3 C warming, when scientists warn that staying below 1.5 C warming is what is needed to avert catastrophe.

Despite being in charge of the wealthiest country in the world, the... U.S. government — Democrat and Republican — is doing nothing to mitigate or prepare for the looming catastrophe. Even in the liberal bastion of California, state leadership is not taking the crisis seriously. California is the fifth largest economy in the world, yet there is no money for people’s needs while Big Tech gets tax breaks.

If humanity is to survive this crisis, we must immediately put all resources into preparing for what’s currently unfolding and what’s to come. We must immediately transition off fossil fuels and restore ecosystems that capture carbon from the atmosphere. We must protect the population from climate disasters and provide real relief for people in the aftermath.

Capitalism has proven time and again that it is incapable and unwilling to meet the needs of the people. If we don’t uproot the system that has created the climate crisis, that continues to ignore it and go about business as usual, the majority of us face a truly dire not-too-distant future. The people have the power to change the path we are on — to share the challenges together and build a better world for all.”

See MoreSan Francisco skyline tainted orange from wildfire smoke, Sept. 9 As I write this article from San Francisco, Calif., the sky is dark orange and I need to have my desk lamp on to see, despite that it’s midday. There is so much smoke in the atmosphere above the summer fog layer that... #environment

item.title: The significance of the new Space Force military doctrine cannot...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

The significance of the new Space Force military doctrine cannot be overstated. Whether Trump or Biden wins, the Space Force doctrine will be operational. And Democrats have shown they will wield all aspects of the military industrial complex just as effectively and ruthlessly as Republicans.

In preparation for “major power” conflict in coming years, the Pentagon and U.S. government are prioritizing advancing technologies and capabilities to dominate and control space, with the belief that conquering the “ultimate high ground” of space will allow them to win... #antimilitarism #a...

item.title: We could be headed to the most volatile election in U.S....
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

We could be headed to the most volatile election in U.S. history, with both candidates refusing to concede. Could this lead to violence on the street? Monica Cruz of BreakThrough analyzes the potential for an historic ruling class crisis.

BreakThrough News

On Election Night 2020, the map could show Trump with an overwhelming victory, only to be reversed by the counting of mail-in ballots. We could be headed to the... most volatile election in U.S. history, with both candidates refusing to concede. Could this lead to violence on the street? Monica Cruz of BreakThrough analyzes the potential for an historic ruling class crisis.

See MoreVisit the Voting Information Center for election resources and official updates. Get Voting Information
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: Yesterday some 1500 community members marched on foot and in...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Yesterday some 1500 community members marched on foot and in their cars down Colfax from Aurora to Denver against racism and police violence. People all along the march came out of their homes and shops and stopped on the streets to watch and show their support. Families from across the state who have had their loved ones murdered by the police came to speak and march with us.

People all over this country are tired of the racism and the brutality of life under this system. They are ready for change! The future lies in the hands of the people! Together we will one day crush this racist system and build one that works for all of us!

Keep building, keep fighting! All power to the people!

+46
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation
